intro: Leandra clidemioides, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a silvery or grayish pubescence. The plant produces showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows as a tree or shrub and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in warm climates for its aesthetic appeal and habitat support.
